s.text: In that sense, the fact that Planet Hollywood won't just die testifies to two things: the continued strength of inertia in American business and the continued distance between the interests of corporate managers and corporate shareholders.
But when you look at how tenaciously Planet Hollywood is clinging to life, it seems clear that even fools can survive.
In today's hypercompetitive world, it's easy to believe that Andy Grove is right, and that only the paranoid survive.
If you're being paid well to be captain, it's a lot better to let the ship slowly sink, even if scuttling it is what's best for everyone on board.
